Indebted to the wrong people, with his life on the line, veteran of the U.S. Cavalry and now hired gun, Booker DeWitt has only one opportunity to wipe his slate clean. He must rescue Elizabeth, a mysterious girl imprisoned since childhood and locked up in the flying city of Columbia.

Buen FPS

BIOSHOCK INFINITE самая любимая игра этой серии.Здесь можно найти много интересного для себя: красивую графику, простой геймплей, множество оружия и улучшений для него, атмосферную музыку, интересный сюжет с неожиданными поворотами. Иногда встречаются баги анимаций (Элизабет идёт не передвигая ногами или двигается рывками) или звука (гранаты пожарников издают дикие, скрежечащие звуки, которые нельзя остановить), но они не критичные.В общем в игру стоит поиграть и потратить своё время.

单从射击游戏的角度上来讲枪械种类虽然多样，但是射击手感一般，枪械没有明显后坐力；有魔法系统作为辅助输出，但是实用的又只有一两个，没有明显亮点，但是，跟它的优点比起来，这些瑕疵都可以忽略不计。
唯美的画面，动人的剧情，曲折的故事线，以及优秀的配乐交织成了一座生动立体的哥伦比亚城，为了不剧透，就不在此详细描述了。
最后就是伊丽莎白小天使，天真浪漫，在你搜索物资的时候静静地等待，或者百无聊赖得在周围走走看看，甚至还会帮你找到一些落下的道具，又或是给你扔过来几个铜币；在战斗时根本不需要你来操心就自己躲得严严实实，在你没弹药、没血没魔的时候又会适时得给你扔来物资救你于危难之中。她并不像其他游戏中NPC那样仅仅就是个开门工具，而是一个在游戏的点点滴滴中陪伴你一起成长的懵懂女孩。
这游戏看起来很美，但是却有点黑暗，特别是玩了DLC后
买买买！不买不是人！！！

Excellent FPS. Great game mechanics and amazing story.

Si me preguntaran por mis videojuegos favoritos probablemente Biosock Infinite figuraría en esa lista.

En esta nueva entrega cambiamos los lúgubres túneles subterráneos de Rapture por una ciudad voladora llena de enigmas y una historia fascinante: Columbia.

Por algo Irrational Games ha sabido sentar las bases de una característica que ha definido toda una generación de videojuegos: la clave de un buen escenario. Esta nueva Columbia no escatima en detalles, ambientación dentro de un enfoque distino, y varios elementos de interacción que conforman un ecosistema vivo. Si a todo esto añadimos un sistema de armas y vigorizantes (los tónicos de esta entrega) que funciona a la perfección y que ha recibido pocas mejoras (hay poco que mejorar de algo que ya funciona bien) obtenemos esta fórmula mágica que sabe contarnos una historia sin que todo lo demás carezca de importante.

Y la historia es realmente absorbente. Diría que incluso me ha sabido atraer incluso más que la primera entrega. Los viajes en el tiempo y los universos paralelos son un tema recurrente que se utiliza en muchas series, películas y videojuegos, pero en pocas ocasiones se utiliza este trasfondo para contar algo realmente interesante como la historia de Booker DeWitt. Se trata de un puzzle magistral sobre el que se van presentando al jugador las distintas piezas, que van encajando hasta conformar un final que hace que unas todos los puntos para trazar una conclusión que no eres capaz de ver hasta el último momento.

Imprescindible 10/10

[h1] BIOSHOCK INFINITE REVIEW [/h1]
[b](Includes spoilers, be warned!)[/b]  

[b]Synopsis:
Booker Dewitt is a man that gets sent to enter the flying city of Columbia, and retrieve the daughter of the prophetic founder and leader of the city Zachary Hale Comstock. Columbia was founded on American ideals and is a embodiment of the American dream. Booker soon realizes that he is the so called False shepherd that is seen as the one that will kidnap Elizabeth, its also revealed that Columbia isn't perfect and has a dark side to it. Booker meets with Elizabeth and gets access to her cross-dimensional powers named "Tears". The two try to find escape whilst getting chased by Comstock and his men, during the midst of a slowly commencing civil war[/b]  

[b]Story, characters and world building:
The story is overall good with interesting characters and with great themes accompanying it. The world building is detailed thanks to the use of visual and verbal storytelling and Voxophones (this game's audio diaries).[/b] Booker is a really fascinating person, with his backstory and character development he was a satisfying "Shock" protagonist for me. I love Elizabeth, her design and personality is so spot on, and her character development is great to. Starting as a naive innocent girl and transforming into a mature and tragic character. Comstock was also a nice villain, but he never comes close to being as great as Andrew Ryan, he is in another league of greatness. The games first two levels are overall fantastic. The intro is beautifully crafted, with the fair section being really fun to play through. The dreadful atmosphere of the city right after the scene with the interracial couple, the cult house, its so great. Soldiers field is also a great level. The ending levels in Comstock house and the zeppelin are also really good. The games various historical references and parallels to Rapture are also good. I really enjoyed the ending to, it was a bit convoluted but the emotion was spot on.

[b]Let's now talk about actual issues in the games story, that stop the story from becoming perfect. The game felt like it had some really great ideas that fully never got realized, possibly because of development hell. Most of these ideas can be seen in better detail in the E3 trailers.[/b] The middle of the game and even some ending parts of the game is also quite rocky storywise, with a few plotholes (not game ruining necessarily), undeveloped story elements and characters and even a section in the Finkton level of the game, where there is a lot of back and forth. Essentially the story can feel messy in some areas. The ending as said can be convoluted, if you think to deeply about it, in certain ways the ending can be overwhelming and rushed. For me the strongest part of the story is its characters, primarily Booker and Elizabeth, and when the story hits, it really hits. So in my eyes the flaws don't bother my experience, but this doesn't nullify the existence of the lackluster parts of the story. 

To describe what I mean about the stories messiness, Daisy Fitzroy, leader of the civil war against the city started as a good character, but could have had a longer and more complex character development.(Spoilers)[spoiler]I would have wanted to see her in Emporia instead of her dying so early on, there she could have started to develop as a character instead of her "snapping" being so abrupt. Seeing her just like in the E3 trailer would be fucking amazing. As her speeches echo over the chaos going on.[/spoiler] There is so much more I could discuss, such as the underplayed roles of Songbird and the American themes that were more prominent in the E3 trailers, the scrapped characters, and much more! But I don't want to draw out so I will end it here.

[b]Gameplay and environment:
The gameplay overall carries the core aspects of the prior Bioshock games. With various new additions such as the skyhook, skylines and various different new enemies to spice things up. The gun play and exploration is smooth and enjoyable, each environment is full of top notch detail and collectibles.[/b] 
This games plasmids, named Vigors, are also really fun to use and their bottle designs are ten times better then the original BS1 to be frank. In this game they are so uniqe and perfectly describe the power they harbor, unlike the reused bottle designs in BS1. The skylines are a great addition and the new enemies are great to! I really adore Elizabeth's A.I in this game, all the various ways she interacts around the world and she is genuinely a helpful companion in combat, with her Tears and item tossing. Overall smooth as butter gameplay.

[b]But just like the story there are flaws and this is where I will mostly talk about the E3 trailers. The game originally seemed to be a far less linear and more of a bigger game, with a lot of more emphasize on skylines, tears and many other stuff.[/b] Songbird seemed to be originally a bigger threat, rather then the final version of him that only appears in cut-scenes (Spoilers)[spoiler]During the final bits of the game you do get the chance to use him as a combat companion in gameplay, but that isn't enough to be honest. But him kicking the shit out of everything was amazing though.[/spoiler] The Gear system (this games Gene tonics) where quite okay, could have been better but not the worst either, I would have preferred if you got to buy most of the Gear, because in the final game they are just collectibles. Instead, they could have made the more special Gear secrets to collect for those who had extra interest in Gears. A lot of RPG mechanics where also toned down making the game more of an action adventure bame rather then an fps RPG. One last thing I would mention is the smaller role some really great enemies types were given, especially the Siren and The Boys of Silence, enemies with such wasted potential. The game could have been much more like the older games in this regard.

[b]Voice acting, soundtrack and visuals:
Infinite's visuals and soundtrack are unbelievably full of finesse and personality, the visuals truly made my jaw drop, especially the intro. [/b] The only thing that bothered me visually was the repetitive NPC models and a few models what looked to angular, aside from that, fantastic visuals! The soundtrack is beautifully composed ranging from great foreshadowing, intense emotion and awe-inspiring melodies. The song named "Elizabeth" is my favorite one since it perfectly portrays Elizabeth and all the tragedy in her story. The voice acting is full of emotion and dedication with great voice performances from Troy Baker, Courtnee Draper and many other talented people. 

[b]Final verdict: Overall a good package that offers a, although heavily flawed, impactful and emotional story with a lot of great character momments. With a jawdroppig art style and visuals, and with an good gameplay that keeps the game fun and engaging.[/b] The game could have been better, but is quite fantastic for what it is. I know people have criticized this game, for fair reasons that I understand and even agree with many ways. But personally, I will love this game for what it does right and excels in. The team once at Irrational games excelled in creating an riveting character focused story, with original and fascinating themes, art style, and twists. 

+Good characters
+Fun and engaging gameplay
+Beautiful art style and graphics
+Great overall designs
+Great soundtrack
-Lackluster gear system
-Story that can be messy and rushed in some areas
-Gameplay could have been more like past games
-Visuals problems such as repetitive NPC models

[b]Overall a flawed game, that's really good, but that if fully realized, could have been one of the most revolutionary games of all time. A flawed masterpiece.[/b]

Ну, что можно сказать об этой игре, она великолепна во всех смыслах. После мрачного и серого Восторга окунуться в яркую и приветливую (ну или не совсем приветливую) Колумбию было довольно приятно. Запоминающиеся главные герои и относительно запутанный сюжет придают игре большой интерес. Единственный минус, который я могу для себя отметить, это то, что концовка всего одна, в отличие от первых двух частей. Надеюсь разработчики не положат окончательно крест на эту великолепную франшизу.

Best game I've ever played

Tengo que admitir que este juego me ha dejado un buen sabor de boca y lo puedo calificar como una muy agradable experiencia.
En lo que se refiere a jugabilidad "Bioshock Infinite" es bastante dinámico e interesante. En su apartado de diseño artístico,destacan, tanto armas, como localizaciones y personajes teniendo estos siempre una característica interesante (Por ejemplo los uniformes y vestimentas de los habitantes de Columbia, el diseño de la pistola inicial, el hecho de que Elizabeth sea un personaje tan iconico).

He jugado los tres títulos de esta saga pero por esta razón me atrevo a decir que este puede ser el único punto donde veo que esta entrega cojea un poco, ya que como mencione anteriormente este es un gran juego en general, pero no un gran Bioshock ya que en mi opinión, todo el espíritu de "terror" u "horror" de los dos títulos originales así como el Hackeo, Little Sisters y (en la campaña original) rueda de armas desaparece para dar paso a acción mucho mas pura,basada en la eliminación de unos pocos elementos estrategicos de juegos anteriores.

A pesar de lo anteriormente mencionado, siempre considerare incesantemente a este juego como uno de mis favoritos personales por una larga temporada.
